title: Vinoce 2012 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)
description: Milk chocolate, blueberry and black currant combine around a soft core of subdued tannins and classical weavings of cedar and dried herb in this mountain-grown wine. It finishes in puckering leather.

title: Wagner 2012 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)
description: Tobacco box and cedar notes lend savory nuances to this stately, but slightly subdued Cabernet Sauvignon. Delicate black plum and cherry flavors are crisp and cool, fringed by soft fine tannins. Drink now through 2018.

title: Waterbrook 2014 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of plum, blackberry, vanilla, dried herbs and spice provide intrigue. The blue- and black-fruit flavors are linear in style but deliver enjoyment.

title: Bellangelo 2014 Tuller Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: Pollen and dusty minerals lend an earthy savoriness to lemon, saffron and honeysuckle in this off-dry Riesling. The palate is bright and brisk, finishing on a delicately honeyed note. Drink now through 2019.

title: Bonacchi 2010 Molino della Suga  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: Aromas of scorched earth, game and a whiff of farmyard lead the nose. The palate offers dried black cherry, leather, anise and sage alongside bracing but fleeting tannins. It finishes abruptly, leaving a rather astringent close.

title: Bostavan 2014 Dor Traminer-Chardonnay White (Moldova)
description: sweet-tart candy, vanilla, and pineapple scent this Traminer and Chardonnay blend. It's zesty in the mouth, tasting of grapefruit and lemon zest.

title: Naggiar 2012 La Boheme Estate Reserve Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: The aroma is very ripe, almost like a Port wine. Flavors are deep and ripe, with a twinge of dried fruit, and the texture is appropriately firm and tannic. It's a bold, hearty and full-bodied Bordeaux-style blend.

title: Sawtooth 2014 Sawtooth Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Gris
description: Light aromas of yellow apple, pear and spice lead to off-dry flavors that trail toward the finish.

title: Philippe Girard 2014 Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)
description: This rounded wine is still tight and closed. The texture shows strongly at the moment, but will soften to bring out the crisp fruits and perfumed acidity. A rustic edge needs to blow away as the wine matures. Drink from 2017.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Syrupy red cherry, hibiscus and fruit-punch aromas show on the nose of this good-deal wine, along with touches of graphite and crushed potpourri. It's broad and a touch ripe on the palate, with pomegranate and marjoram notes.

title: El Cortijillo 2014 Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: A floral red-fruit nose opens this juicy yet basic Tempranillo. Raw edginess on the palate comes with candied plum and raspberry flavors, while this finishes fresh, with a modest salty note.

title: Fattoria Montecchio 2012  Chianti Classico
description: Straightforward and easy drinking, this opens with aromas of violet, ripe berry and a whiff of menthol. On the palate, notes of star anise and dried sage lightly accent dried black cherry.

title: Huston 2013 Riesling
description: This lightly reductive wine has aromas of white peach, honeysuckle and the underside of a pineapple. It drinks medium sweet with tangerine flavors on the finish.

title: Il Cavalierino 2011  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Dense and one-dimensional, this opens with faint aromas of raisin, leather and a whiff of spice. The evolved palate offers stewed plum, a green note of unripe cherry, powdered sage and a hint of licorice. Raspy tannins create an abrupt, astringent finish.

title: Foundry 2012 Broken Rock Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Chocolate-covered cherry and plum surround a shock of stark acidity on this wine that has a round and soft palate. On the finish, a touch of astringency flirts with cedar.

title: Lander-Jenkins 2012 Pinot Noir (California)
description: An extreme ripeness in aroma and flavor pumps this wine up to nearly the point of bursting. It is bold, super fruity, full bodied and concentrated.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2014 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Cherry and blueberry aromas are floral at first, then a touch grassy after airing. This feels full and bouncy, while salty plum and berry flavors are limited but fine. This holds form on the finish.

title: Levendi 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This smoothly round and full-bodied wine offers a taste of the tropics, combining pineapple, payapa and coconut in tone and flavor. The oak (only 20% of it new) is pronounced, though on the way to integration, .

title: Domaines Tatin 2014 Domaine du Tremblay Vin Noble  (Quincy)
description: If you want a truly herbal, grassy wine, look no further. This wine is tight, crisp and green with juicy green-plum acidity. It is forward, all fruit with just a tang of texture at the end. Drink now.

title: Irony 2013 Small Lot Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Lighter in color, this wine packs fruit punch, cola and ripe cranberry into the nose. Flavors mix juicy strawberries with Earl Grey tea, marjoram and orange rind elements.

title: Balverne 2013 Estate Grown Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Somewhat muted, this estate-grown wine is most exuberant in pine and dusty cherry. Full bodied and robust on the palate, it retains a grip of tannin from start to finish.

title: Block 88 2013 Red (Napa Valley)
description: A combination of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot, this wine is thick, dense and extracted. Fully robust in tannin, it features a powerful grip of gunpowder, blackberry and currant, making it a good choice for barbecue.

title: Chartron et Trébuchet 2014  Bourgogne
description: Warm, fruity and ripe, this offers a good balance between a ripe, creamy, yellow-fruit character and juicy acidity that refreshes and gives a crisp aftertaste. The wine is totally ready to drink.

title: Bodegas Campante 2014 White (Ribeiro)
description: Light, almost neutral aromas are like stream water touched up with lime. This is basic on the palate, but easy to process. Flavors of papaya and melon are a bit leesy, while this Treixadura-Torrontés blend is short on the finish.

title: Breca 2014 De Fuego Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Saucy blueberry aromas are a touch muddled and difficult to decipher, while this Garnacha feels medium in body and healthy. Raspberry and plum flavors come with a resiny, pasty oak note, while medicinality rises up on the finish.

title: Conarium 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light, clear and unfiltered, this vineyard-designate has elements of Christmas tree pine, spearmint and forest floor. Crisp on the palate and somewhat austere, it finishes clean and quick.

title: Cramele Recas 2014 Dreambird Moscato (Viile Timisului)
description: This slightly sweet Moscato has aromas of fresh cut pineapple, magnolia, peaches, honeysuckle and dried anise seed. The palate gets lychee and apricot.

title: Domaine Alban Roblin 2014  Sancerre
description: This ripe wine has spice as well as red-berry fruits. Good acidity combines with light tannins to deliver a balanced wine with a mineral edge that should age for a few more months. Drink from 2017.

title: Domaine des Elephants 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: Intensely herbal, this is a ripe, fresh and fruity wine. It has a grassy character that partners with tropical-fruit flavors. Drink now.

title: Yorkville Cellars 2013 Rennie Vineyard Organic Grapes Malbec (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Whiffs of butter and vanilla in the aroma lead to a soft and supple wine that tastes like baking spices and cherries. It's very polished and almost soft in texture.
